security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing Angular authentication patterns. All 55 static findings are false positives. The skill shows legitimate JWT handling (atob for payload decoding), Angular lazy-loading syntax (import()), template literals (backticks), and standard token storage (DA_SERVICE_TOKEN). No malicious code, scripts, or unauthorized network access is present.

content.user_title: Add secure authentication to Angular apps
content.value_statement: Building secure authentication in Angular requires careful implementation of tokens, guards, and permission checks. This skill provides ready-to-use patterns for JWT management, role-based access control, and route protection using the @delon/auth library.
actual_capabilities: Implement login and logout flows with Firebase Auth integration
Configure JWT token storage with automatic refresh before expiration
Create route guards for authentication and authorization checks
Implement role-based and permission-based access control systems
Set up HTTP interceptors for automatic token injection in requests
Integrate with @delon/acl for UI-level permission controls
limitations: Does not provide backend authentication endpoints
Requires existing Firebase project for Firebase Auth integration
Does not include multi-factor authentication setup
Only supports Angular applications using @delon/auth library

use_cases.title: Add login to Angular app
use_cases.description: Implement secure user login with JWT tokens, automatic session management, and protected routes.

use_cases.title: Build role-based access
use_cases.description: Create admin, user, and custom role permissions with route guards and component-level access checks.

use_cases.title: Secure API communication
use_cases.description: Configure automatic token injection in HTTP requests with refresh before expiration and secure storage.

prompt_templates.title: Basic login setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Use @delon/auth to add authentication to my Angular app. Include login component with email and password, JWT token storage, and automatic token injection in HTTP headers.

prompt_templates.title: Route protection
prompt_templates.prompt: Create auth guards using @delon/auth that redirect unauthenticated users to login page. Protect the dashboard and admin routes.

prompt_templates.title: Role permissions
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement role-based access control with @delon/auth. Create guards for admin, manager, and user roles. Show how to check permissions in components.

prompt_templates.title: Token refresh
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure automatic token refresh with @delon/auth. Handle expired tokens by logging out user and clearing session. Integrate with Firebase Auth token refresh.

output_examples.input: Add authentication to my Angular app with Firebase Auth
output: Create AuthService with login() and logout() methods
Set up authGuard to protect routes from unauthenticated access
Configure automatic token injection in HTTP requests
Implement token refresh before expiration (6000ms offset)

output_examples.input: Create role-based access control for admin and user roles
output: Define roleGuard to check user role against route data
Create hasRole() method in AuthService for role checking
Protect admin routes with roleGuard and data: { role: 'admin' }
Implement hasPermission() for fine-grained permission checks
Sync permissions with @delon/acl for UI element control
Handle unauthorized access with redirect to /exception/403

best_practices: Always use HTTPS in production to protect token transmission
Set short token expiration times and use refresh tokens for long sessions
Clear all authentication state on logout including tokens and user data
anti_patterns: Storing tokens in localStorage without encryption - use DA_SERVICE_TOKEN instead
Skipping role validation on backend - always validate permissions server-side
Allowing unauthenticated access to protected routes without proper guards

faq.question: Which Angular versions are supported?
faq.answer: @delon/auth supports Angular 17+ with standalone components and the new control flow syntax.

faq.question: How long should JWT tokens last?
faq.answer: Short-lived access tokens (15-30 minutes) with refresh tokens are recommended. Configure refreshOffset to 6000ms.

faq.question: Can this integrate with other auth providers?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill shows Firebase Auth integration but @delon/auth works with any OAuth2 or JWT-based provider.

faq.question: Is user data stored securely?
faq.answer: Tokens are stored securely via DA_SERVICE_TOKEN. Avoid storing sensitive user data in client-side storage.

faq.question: How to debug auth issues?
faq.answer: Enable debug logging for authentication events. Check browser DevTools for token presence in requests.

faq.question: How does this compare to Auth0 or Firebase Auth alone?
faq.answer: @delon/auth adds Angular-specific features like route guards, HTTP interceptors, and ACL integration on top of any auth provider.
